Utterance: <sigh> Hi Ellie, it's nice to see you again.
Hi! It’s great to see you too. How have you been since our last session?
I've been okay, just trying to get back into my routine after my trip.
I remember you mentioned struggling with getting back into your exercise routine. How has that been going?
It's still a challenge. I went for a couple of walks, but I find it hard to motivate myself to go regularly.
That’s understandable. Sometimes it takes a little push to get back into a habit. Have you thought about setting smaller, more achievable goals for yourself?
Yeah, I’ve been thinking about just starting with short walks, maybe 15-20 minutes a day, instead of trying to do longer hikes right away.
That sounds like a great plan! Starting small can make it feel less overwhelming. Have you been able to incorporate that yet?
I did manage to go for a short walk yesterday. It felt good, but I still have to remind myself to keep it up.
It’s a step in the right direction! How did you feel after your walk?
I felt relaxed and clear-headed, like it was a nice break from my work.
That’s wonderful to hear! Physical activity can be a great way to relieve stress. Are there any other activities that help you feel this way?
I’ve been meditating daily, and that really helps too. I feel more centered when I do it.
Meditation can be very beneficial. What type of meditation are you practicing?
I usually do guided meditations, focusing on my breath and letting go of thoughts.
That sounds effective. Have you noticed any changes in your mood or anxiety levels since you started meditating?
I think it has helped reduce my anxiety, especially when I feel overwhelmed with work.
That’s a positive outcome. What specifically at work has been causing you stress lately?
Well, it’s the busy season for our organization, and I feel a lot of pressure to make sure everything runs smoothly.
It’s understandable to feel that pressure. Have you found any strategies to manage that stress during this busy time?
I’ve been trying to prioritize my tasks and break them down into smaller steps. It helps me feel less overwhelmed.
That’s a great approach! Breaking tasks down can make them feel more manageable. How has that been working for you?
It’s been okay. Some days I stick to it, and other days I feel like I’m drowning in everything.
It’s normal to have ups and downs. On the days you feel overwhelmed, what do you do to help yourself?
I usually take a short break, step outside, or do a quick meditation to reset.
Those are excellent coping strategies. It’s important to take those breaks. Have you been able to communicate with your team about your workload?
I’ve mentioned it to my supervisor, and she’s been supportive, which helps.
That’s good to hear. Having a supportive work environment can make a big difference. How do you feel about asking for help when you need it?
I find it hard sometimes. I don't want to seem like I'm struggling.
It’s understandable to feel that way, but asking for help is a sign of strength, not weakness. Would it be helpful to practice how you might ask for support?
Yeah, that could be useful. Maybe I could approach it as a team effort.
That sounds like a positive perspective! You could frame it as wanting to collaborate to ensure everyone’s workload is manageable.
I like that idea. I’ll try to keep that in mind next time I feel overwhelmed.
Great! Let’s also revisit that dream you mentioned in our last session. Have you had it again since then?
I did have it again last week. It was frustrating because it felt so real.
I can see why that would be distressing. Have you noticed any specific triggers that might lead to that dream?
Not really, but I’ve been feeling more anxious about work, so maybe that’s contributing.
That’s quite possible. Sometimes our subconscious reflects our waking anxieties. It might be worth exploring those feelings further.
Yeah, I think I need to. I don’t want that dream to keep bothering me.
Absolutely. Would you like to work on some techniques to address that anxiety before it manifests in your dreams?
Yes, I’d like that.
We could try some visualization techniques or journaling to express those feelings before bed. Would you be open to that?
Definitely, I think that could help.
Wonderful! Let’s set that as a goal for our next session. How about you try journaling your thoughts before sleep this week?
Sounds good! I’ll give it a shot.
Great! I’m looking forward to hearing how it goes. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that covers most of it. Thank you for the suggestions!
You’re welcome! I’m glad to help. Let’s meet again next week to check in on your progress.
Sounds good. See you then!
Bye for now!
Bye!
